direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check the connection state of the socket but with different criteria.
Both methods check the state of the socket but for different states (closed vs. connecting).
The connect method directly affects the state checked by isConnecting.
The accept method can also affect the connection state checked by isConnecting.
isConnecting relies on the state returned by getState to determine its result.
The close method can change the state of the socket, affecting the result of isConnecting.
doConnect is a private method that directly affects the connection state, similar to connect.
Similar to accept(int), this method can affect the connection state checked by isConnecting.
This method is part of the PseudoTCPBase lifecycle and can affect the connection state.
